• Quantum entanglement is a feature of quantum mechanics that has captured much recent interest due to its essential role in quantum information processing.
• It may be characterized and manipulated independently of its physical realization, and it obeys a set of conservation laws.
• It proves useful in making quantitative predictions to quantify entanglement.
• When one has complete information about a bipartite system, the state of the system is pure and there exists a well-established measure of entanglement, the von Neumann entropy of the reduced density matrix, with a unity for the bell states and a conserved under local operations and classical communication.
• Unfortunately, quantum systems in nature interact with their environment; states of practical concern are therefore mixed, in which case the quantification of entanglement becomes less clear.
• Given an ensemble of pure states, the weighted average of the state of the system is its entanglement measure, which is unity for the bell states and conserved under local operations and classical communication.
• Various measures have been proposed to circumvent this problem, most of which evaluate a lower bound.
• One such measure, the entanglement of formation, is defined as the minimal amount of entanglement required to form the density operator, while the entanglement of distillation is the guaranteed amount of entanglement that can be extracted from the density operator.
• These measures satisfy the requirements for a physical entanglement measure set out by Horodecki et al. • They give the value zero for the bell states, which might be thought somewhat counterintuitive, since this state can be viewed as representing a sequence of random "choices" between two bell states, both of which are maximally entangled.

• Therefore, we need to develop new methods to identify parameters capable of describing phase transitions.

* Aql x-1, a SXRT, is the most active SXRT known, with more than 30 X-ray and/or optical outbursts detected so far. The companion star has been identified as the k1v variable star V1333Aql, with an orbital period of 19 hours. The outbursts of Aql x-1 are generally characterized by a fast rise followed by a slow decay, with an equivalent bremsstrahlung temperature of 10 keV. The outburst is characterized by a sharp decrease around mjd 50512, which is well described by an exponential decay with an 17-fold folding time. The spectrum is consistent with a black body temperature of 10 keV, but the radius decreases by a factor of 19 from the decay phase to quiescence. The spectrum is consistent with a black body plus a power law model. The outburst is characterized by a sharp flux decay leading to the quiescent state of Aql x-1, which is reminiscent of the final evolution of dwarf novae outbursts.

* The paper investigates the phenomenological consequences of hypercharged anomaly-mediated SUSY breaking models at the LHC. It calculates the expected sparticle mass spectrum and parameter space for the HCAMSB model. The study compares the reach of the LHC for HCAMSB models assuming 100 fb of integrated luminosity. The paper finds an LHC reach of 108 fb for low values of \( \mathbf{a} \) and 109 fb for large \( \mathbf{a} \). It also compares the reach for \( \mathbf{a} \) and \( \mathbf{a} \) for the \( \mathbf{b} \) channel. • The paper discusses the numerical solution of initial value systems of convection-diffusion equations with both Dirichlet and Neumann boundary conditions using modified exponential cubic B-splines (MECB) and modified trigonometric cubic B-splines (MTCB) methods. • The invention is an esophageal displacement electrode designed to achieve greater efficiency in performing procedures such as defibrillation and pacing the heart.
• The electrode includes a semi rigid plastic tube with an electrode on the distal end and a control mechanism for bending the tube.
• The tube is crimped at the distal end to form a hinge that enables it to bend easily.
• The tube is connected to a displacement mechanism that causes the last couple of inches of the distal end to bend back on itself approximately 135 degrees from its original position.

• The electrode is designed to be used in a noninvasive procedure such as pacing or defibrillation, and to reduce the energy required to carry out the procedure.

<summary>Radial Reflection Diffraction Tomography (RRDT) Imaging System and Method</summary>

* The present invention employs inverse wave techniques to reconstruct images of a medium surrounding a physical probe in a radial reflection configuration, including multimonostatic and multistatic probes.

* The present invention describes a biological oil composition, formulations, and methods for preventing or treating cardiovascular disease.
* The oil composition comprises copepod oil and EPA/DHA, and is derived from a marine copepod species, Calanus finmarchicus.
* The copepod oil has a high content of SDA (stearidonic acid) and is low-viscous and free-flowing at room temperature.
* The copepod oil composition is used as a medicament for the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular disease.
* The copepod oil composition is isolated from a marine copepod species and is used as a pharmaceutical preparation.
* The copepod oil composition is used as a functional food formulation.
* The copepod oil composition is used as a dietary supplement formulation.
* The copepod oil composition is used as a pharmaceutical formulation for the prevention or treatment of cardiovascular disease.
* The copepod oil composition is used as a method for prophylaxis or treatment of cardiovascular disease, particularly atherosclerosis, hypercholesterolaemia, and elevated blood cholesterol levels.

• Polyelectrolyte complexes show properties that meet biocompatible polymer requirements and can be adapted to various therapeutic and diagnostic applications.
• Microparticles composed of polyelectrolyte complexes can be prepared in average particle sizes from a few nanometers to several hundred micrometers.
• Polyelectrolyte complexes can be prepared in various forms, including aqueous solutions, hydrophobic derivatives, and emulsions.
• Polyelectrolyte complexes can be converted into microparticulate forms by precipitation, encapsulation, or incorporation of active substances.
• Polyelectrolyte complexes can be used as carriers for active substances, such as cytostatic agents, antibiotics, and vaccines.
• Polyelectrolyte complexes can be converted into ultrasonic contrast agents for diagnostic purposes, providing enhanced therapeutic effects and improved bioavailability.
• Polyelectrolyte complexes can be used as air-containing echogenic contrast agents for ultrasonic diagnosis, offering enhanced therapeutic effects and improved bioavailability.

• The device permits a golf club to be utilized as the handle, reducing the weight and size of the device.

• The invention proposes a reflectance measurement apparatus for measuring skin reflectance.
• The apparatus comprises a probe with an aperture for light transmission, a flexible connection in fiber optics for measuring reflectance, and a display device for indicating the reflectance value.
• The probe is designed to be small and miniaturized, suitable for measuring reduced areas of the skin surface.
• The apparatus is adaptable to different skin types, including greasy skin, by using a matte surface reference.
• The apparatus tolerates small variations in light intensity and ambient light, making it suitable for various skin conditions.
• The reflectance measurement is performed by comparing specular reflection and diffuse reflection values.
• The apparatus is capable of measuring reflectance values for different skin types, including greasy skin.
• The results are displayed on a display device for easy viewing and positioning.
• The apparatus is suitable for use in pathology and cosmetology, measuring skin reflectance for various skin conditions.
• The invention is applicable for grading different types of skin, including greasy skin.
• The apparatus is adaptable to various skin types, including greasy skin, by using a matte surface reference.
• The results are compared with general skin reflectance values obtained in 32 random cases.
• The results show a high correlation between skin reflectance and visual appearance, justifying its use as an objective means for quantifying skin reflectance.

• The invention provides a dental cleaning and massaging apparatus that includes a mouthpiece with upper and lower channel members for brushing teeth and massaging the gums. The apparatus includes a first or outer membrane and a second or inner membrane to seal the area between the uppermost part of the upper channel member and the lowermost part of the lower channel member. The apparatus also includes bite blocks located in the upper and lower channel members to provide massaging action on the gums. The apparatus includes a hose or tube with air-sacks to provide air pulses and water or cleaning fluid to clean and massage the teeth and gums. The apparatus can be operated with either air or water alone or both air and water. The apparatus can be operated with either air alone or cleaning fluid alone. The apparatus can be operated with either air and water or cleaning fluid.

• The invention describes a novel electro-surgical dissecting and cauterizing instrument for use primarily in laparoscopic/endoscopic procedures, including the use of an endoscope to view the operation site.
• The instrument includes a rigid arm extending between the distal, working tip electrode and the insulating sleeve, with the arm laterally offset from the longitudinal axis of the sleeve.
• The arm includes portions laterally offset from the linear axis x--x of the sleeve, providing maximum visualization of the working tip electrode and operation site.
• The working tip electrode is formed at the free end of the arm and is used to make direct contact with the patient at the internal operation site.
• The insulating jacket 30 is disposed upon the entire length of arm 26 to prevent unintentional cauterization of healthy tissue surrounding the operation site.

<summary>• The present invention provides a magnetic resonance imaging apparatus with adjustable exposure parameters for high-contrast exposures, allowing for short exposure times even with larger body segments. The apparatus includes a support plate arranged longitudinally within an examination volume, with adjustable longitudinal displacement of the support plate for larger body sections. The apparatus also includes a nuclear spin resonance apparatus with predetermined number of transmit and receive coils. The invention includes a memory to store adjustment parameters until the conclusion of the examination, allowing for quick adjustments during the measurement preparation. High-contrast exposures are obtained due to the separate adjustment process and storage of adjustment parameters until the conclusion of the examination. The invention is suitable for a large number of different magnetic resonance imaging apparatuses, including cylindrical and horseshoe magnets. </summary>

• The present invention provides a releasable fastener for albums, including a pair of strap anchors attached to the front and back covers, with the strap extending between the anchors and being snap-locked into the channel by a locking lip at each end. The strap enters the channel through an aperture in the base of the channel and is folded over and locked beneath the locking lips to retain the ribs in interlocking engagement. The strap anchors are moulded in a plastics material and can be attached to the covers by adhesive. The strap is adjustable in length to accommodate album thickness and can be easily disengaged from the channel by pulling the strap away past the lips. The modified embodiment includes additional ribs on the strap and adjacent lug to improve contact and reduce the risk of slipping.

• The present invention provides a sulky construction with lightweight construction, easy-running, and strong construction to withstand specific strain during exercise and competitions.
• The sulky is made of light metal and other lightweight materials, with a stable and rigid frame that distributes the load to the wheel planes.
• The sulky is assembled by a user, with components such as end frames, shafts, and crossbars, arranged in a stable and reliable manner.
• The sulky is designed to be easily assembled by hand tools, with connections becoming secure without play.
• The sulky is color-coded for individual users, with a solution that leads to inexpensive and individual color displays.
• The sulky is lightweight and easy to store and transport, with a total weight of approximately 18 kg in a ready-to-use state.
• The sulky is designed to be colored by applying color tapes, leading to an inexpensive and individual color display system.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>
The present invention provides a ventilation system for a rotating water feed, including an axial feed duct, an axial discharge duct, and a radial feed duct. The system includes a radial feed duct, a bypass, and an inlet and outlet arrangement. The bypass is arranged in the end face of the feed duct and includes an inlet and an outlet. The system eliminates air bubbles by utilizing the pressure gradient between the inflow and outflow for automatic operation of the device. The bypass is designed as a radially arranged pipe or a coiled pipe, with the inlet opening into the space around the axis of rotation. The bypass is also designed to increase hydrodynamic resistance and minimize bypass flow. The ventilation system is simple in design and construction, with the bypass being arranged in the end face of the feed duct. The bypass is also designed to increase hydrodynamic resistance and minimize bypass flow. The ventilation system is suitable for use in rotating water feeds of water-cooled generators.

* The present invention provides a method for mounting flat, uncontoured glass panels in curved window openings of vehicles, including a method for installing flat glass in vehicle window openings.
* The method involves placing a flat glass panel within a curved window bay, securing it against the reveal molding, and applying adhesive sealant along the perimeter of the glass panel to conform to the window opening.
* The adhesive is applied using a combination of individual resilient clips and a reveal molding, with the clips securing the reveal molding in place.
* The flat glass is flexed slightly to conform to the window opening, and the reveal molding is held in place by the clips.
* The adhesive is cured to permanently hold the glass panel in place, with the flat glass being held in place by the fastener means.
* The method is applicable to various vehicle window sizes, including 18×60 inches and 1/8 inch thick tempered or untempered glass panels.
* The method is advantageous for providing a flexible and bendable window opening, reducing the risk of shattering during an accident.

* The invention relates to power and free conveyor systems, particularly focusing on power and free conveyor systems where carriers are moved along predetermined paths by engaging conveyors.
* The invention includes a third dog that is provided in longitudinally spaced relation to the first and second dogs and is normally urged to an operative carrier pushing position but is held by the track out of operative position.
* The second and third dogs include cam projections that engage portions of the track to hold the second and third dogs out of operative position.
* The cam projections on the second dog extend oppositely to the cam projections on the third dog.
* The invention provides selective transfer of carriers across short or long distances by selectively operable second and third dogs.
* The invention accommodates various systems where the transfer varies between short and long distances.
* The invention can be used for short distances by moving the carrier through the transfer area, while the second and third dogs can be used for long distances.
* The invention can be operated by moving the dogs upwardly simultaneously or sequentially, depending on the desired transfer distance.

• The invention provides a gate valve for dispensing viscous substances, such as sauces, salad dressings, mustard, etc., where one hand can operate while the other hand holds a receiving vessel.
• The valve includes a tubular sleeve with a dispensing package extending through it, and a guide member extending radially outward from the sleeve.
• The valve is mounted on the spout of a bag or pouch, and includes a gate valve guide member and a gate valve member.
• The guide member is curved transversely to the axis of the sleeve, and the gate valve member is reciprocated on the guide member by means of an upward guide and operating channel-like extension.
• The valve can be opened and closed with the fingers of one hand, and can be moved between opened and closed positions with the thumb and index finger.
• The valve can be used in fast-food restaurants or other dispensing applications where one hand is free to hold a receiving vessel.

* The present invention provides a vehicular rearview mirror system that is tolerant of different protocols of an output of a vehicle control.
* The system includes an electro-optic reflective element that assumes a partial reflectance level in response to a drive signal.
* The system includes a mirror control that is responsive to the output of the vehicle control for generating at least one mirror control output.
* The at least one mirror control output includes a value for the drive signal.
* The mirror control determines the protocol of the output of the vehicle control including monitoring the output of the vehicle control in attempting to conclude a state of the output of the vehicle control.

• The present invention relates to improved gas-liquid contacting trays and valve-tray assemblies for higher efficiency operation. • The invention includes a directional thrust valve assembly for a process column of the type wherein liquid flows downwardly from a downcomer onto a first tray and thereacross in a first direction upon the active area thereof through which vapor flows upwardly for interaction and mass transfer with the liquid before passing therefrom. The valve assembly comprises a circular disc with a first leg disposed to intercept the liquid flow across the tray and a second leg disposed along a line perpendicular to the downcomer and generally parallel to the flow therefrom. The valve assembly includes a valve cover mounted by first and second legs, the first leg being disposed to intercept the liquid flow across the tray and being wider than the second leg. The valve assembly further includes means for selectively biasing the rear region of the valve upwardly against the flow of liquid for facilitating initial, directionalized vapor flow therethrough.

* The present invention provides a fluid pressure regulator assembly for generating power while regulating a fluid pressure.
* The assembly includes a pressurized fluid source, a high-pressure line, a vane motor, a fluid regulator, and a generator.
* The vane motor converts pressurized fluid into movement of vanes, which then converts rotational and/or electrical energy.
* The assembly is inexpensive to manufacture and maintain.
* The assembly is lightweight and portable.
* The assembly reduces the size and cost of a regulator needed to regulate the pressure of a fluid.
* The assembly can be used with various types of regulators, including air regulators, air compressors, and air generators.

* The invention features a pallet system for supporting a load of at least one tray having side supports. The system includes a pallet with raised parallel guide rails, end stops, and end plates. * The pallet system restricts both lateral and longitudinal movement of items loaded onto the pallet. * The pallet system provides enhanced stability when loaded and wrapped. * The pallet allows trays to be slid on and off, and is suitable for automated loading and unloading of the trays. * The system restricts the lateral and longitudinal movement of items loaded onto the pallet. * The system provides enhanced stability when loaded and wrapped. * The system restricts the lateral and longitudinal movement of items loaded onto the pallet.

The present invention describes a novel electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension. It features a compact and efficient design with a magnetic suspension radial bearing and axial dual magnetic suspension structure. The rotary-wing system includes magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels with electromotive rings and magnetic suspension shafts, which are suspended on the magnetic suspension shafts in the radial and axial directions. The design avoids contact and friction between the rotary-wing and the saucer shell, reduces noise, and enhances power conversion efficiency. The two improvement solutions mentioned in the invention overcome the reactive torque problem and improve the stability and controllability of the rotary-wing system. The two solutions also ensure operational safety and operational safety of the flying saucer.

* The present invention broadly comprises methods of forming substituted guanidines in the presence of a nickel catalyst.
* Suitable nickel catalysts include nickel in the zero oxidation state.
* The nickel catalysts are derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina.
* The nickel catalysts are particularly advantageous due to their relatively inexpensive cost.
* The nickel catalysts are essentially completely recoverable after the guanylation reactions, allowing them to be reused.
* The nickel catalysts should be present at a level of less than about 10 molar % nickel, and preferably less than about 5 molar % nickel, based upon the total moles of guanylating agent(s) (e.g., isothioureas and/or thioureas) taken as 100%.
* Preferred guanylating agents include thioureas and isothioureas, which have the respective general formulas * and *.
* The nickel catalysts are used to guanylate both aromatic and aliphatic amines at room temperature with high yields.
* The nickel catalysts are preferably carried out at a temperature of from about -30 to 140°C., and more preferably at room temperature or under ambient conditions.
* The nickel catalysts are also preferably carried out in a solvent system, such as DMF, THF, DMSO, and water mixed with any of the foregoing.

* The invention describes a process for producing transgenic plants or plant cells with a DNA sequence of interest and capable of expressing a function of interest from the DNA sequence of interest.
* The process includes providing precursor vectors with at least two different sequences of interest by  Agrobacterium-mediated delivery.
* The DNA sequence of interest is assembled from two precursor vectors by site-specific recombination.
* The DNA sequence of interest may be replicated or non-replicated.
* The process is implemented by various embodiments, including the assembly of DNA sequences of interest from precursor vectors.
* The DNA sequence of interest may be used for screening libraries of coding or regulatory sequences of interest.
* The process allows for the optimization of the sequences to be expressed by testing various transcription, translation assembled units, units with different protein fusions or different protein targeting or post-translational modification.
* The process is applicable for designing safer vectors that are unable to transfer the sequence of interest through an illicit gene transfer.
* The process is efficient for screening libraries of coding or regulatory sequences of interest.
* The process is combined with plant transformation as a one-step procedure, allowing for detailed study of a gene of interest.

• The present invention is a swash plate type compressor for compressing refrigerant gas, which includes a swash plate fixed to a rotary shaft and coated with a fluorocarbon-based coating to reduce frictional wear and improve durability.
• The coating includes lubricious and load bearing additives to enable the polyfluoro elastomer-based coating to simultaneously provide the necessary durability and low coefficient of friction surface.
• The fluorocarbon-based coating is applied to the swash plate in a liquid spray and cured in an oven at elevated temperatures.
• The coated swash plate exhibits very smooth facial surfaces and end surfaces, and can be used with lower cost, low silicon aluminum base materials.
• The coating is different from prior designs by bonding and cross-linking the fluorocarbon directly to the aluminum, providing lubricious and load bearing additives to enhance durability and low coefficient of friction.
• The coating is applied to the swash plate in a liquid spray and cured in an oven at elevated temperatures, allowing for the use of lower cost, low silicon aluminum base materials.

The invention also provides preparation methods for these compounds and anti-reflective coating compositions containing them.

* The invention describes a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film with a thickness in the range from 10 to 350 μm, which is produced from a crystallizable thermoplastic and comprises at least one white pigment, at least one UV absorber, and at least one flame retardant, where expediently the UV absorber and according to invention the flame retardant are fed directly as masterbatch during the production of the film.
* The film is also intended to pass the UL 94 test "Vertical Burning Test for Flammability of Plastic Material", permitting its classification in class 94 VTM-0.
* The film is intended to pass the fire tests to DIN 4102 Part 2 and Part 1, or the UL 94 test.
* The film is intended to be produced cost-effectively and has good orientability and mechanical and optical properties.
* The film is flame retardant, does not embrittle on exposure to heat, is thermoformable, and has high UV resistance.

* The film is intended to be produced cost-effectively and has good orientability and mechanical and optical properties, but not flame retardant, does not embrittle on exposure to heat, is thermoformable, and has high UV resistance.

• The invention provides a novel process for producing 143a in an economical, industrially feasible manner using heterogeneous catalysis.
• The process uses 142b and HF as feedstock, and Cr/Ni/AlF3 catalyst as a catalyst.
• The process achieves high conversion and selectivity for 143a, avoiding olefin formation and other undesirable by-products.
• The process is applicable to the production of 143a from 142b and HF, and can be used to produce 143a from 141b and 142b.
• The process can be carried out at high temperatures and pressures, and is suitable for industrial applications.
• The process is simple, convenient, economical, and can be easily implemented in industrial settings.

• The invention relates to an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of a compound with the formula: •
• Hypophosphorous acid is employed in the deacylation and desulfurization to improve product yield and reduce unwanted impurities. •
• The process involves the reaction of an acylated compound with an aqueous mixture of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric acid or hydrobromic acid to produce hydrogen sulfide and the desired pyrazolotriazole. •

• The deacylation/desulfurization reaction is conducted at a temperature which gives a reasonable rate of reaction but does not cause unwanted side reactions with loss of desired product yield. •
• The invention is characterized by generating less sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities than when no hypophosphorous acid is present. •
• The process is conducted using a Bronsted acid catalyst, such as a Bronsted acid, to facilitate the reaction and improve yield. •
• The invention is suitable for use in the synthesis of pyrazolotriazoles and other compounds with similar structures.

• The invention involves a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with parallel courses of yarns, where the yarns are laid at an angle of approximately 45° to the long axis of the fabric direction, and the yarns are parallel to each other. • The present invention provides a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in and through warp sheds in a multiple-color air jet loom, where air under pressure is ejected from a main nozzle unit or subnozzles to produce different weft carrying forces suited respectively for the different weft threads for thereby carrying the weft threads, one at a time, through the warp shed at the same speed under stable conditions and preventing undue consumption of pressurized air.
• The invention includes a pneumatic piping system for inserting weft threads, with subnozzles divided into groups for producing different additional weft carrying forces to be applied in warp sheds. The subnozzles are spaced at intervals or pitches smaller than those at which the subnozzles in the main nozzle group are spaced.
• The subnozzles are capable of producing the same weft carrying force, and the on-off valves are controlled by weft selection signals A, B supplied from a control unit. When the thicker weft thread is to be inserted by the main nozzle unit, a larger weft carrying force is required. Therefore, the on-off valves are opened by the weft selection signal A to pass the air 15 under a pressure appropriate for the thicker weft thread, whereupon the subnozzles 11, 12 in the subnozzle group I eject the pressurized air 15 to produce a combined stronger air stream necessary for carrying the thicker weft thread.
• The different weft carrying forces may be produced by varying the interval of time in which air is ejected or by varying air ejecting forces. The air ejecting forces are produced by a selective combination of different pitches of subnozzles, different effective cross-sectional areas of nozzle orifices of the subnozzles, different distances of the nozzles from the warp shed, different angles at which the subnozzles are directed to the warp shed, and different pressure under which air is supplied to the subnozzles.
• The on-off valves may be selectively actuated by a mechanical cam device operable in synchronism with the rotation of a main shaft of the loom. For example, the control cam may be mounted on a valve control shaft which makes one third of a full rotation of the main shaft when the main shaft makes one complete revolution, so that the subnozzles 11, 12 will be actuated for inserting one of the thicker weft threads and the subnozzles

<summary>**Summary of the Present Invention****

The present invention provides a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres, and a process of making thereof, in particular, relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through twice health-preserving bast fibres and blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres, together with a process of making thereof. The process includes the steps of: 
1. Health preserving bast fibres; 
2. Opening, cleaning, and carding the health preserved bast fibres, then drawing the carded health preserved bast fibres into bast fibre strips; 
3. Health preserving said bast fibre strips; 
4. Spinning the health preserved bast fibre strips into bast fibre yarn. 

The process also includes the steps of: 
1. Health preserving bast fibres; 
2. Blending the health preserved bast fibres with other fibres, then Opening, cleaning, and carding the blended fibres, after that drawing the carded blended fibres into multi-fibre strips. 
3. Health preserving said multi-fibre strips; 
4. Spinning the health preserved multi-fibres strips into multi-fibre yarn. 

The present invention also provides a multi-fibre yarn obtained through the steps of: 
1. Health preserving bast fibres; 
2. Blending the health preserved bast fibres with other fibres, then Opening, cleaning, and carding the, blended fibres, after that drawing the carded blended fibres into multi-fibre strips. 
3. Health preserving said multi-fibre strips; 
4. Spinning the health preserved multi-fibres strips into multi-fibre yarn. 

The present invention has advantages over existing technologies in terms of reducing end breakage rate and improving spinnability of bast fibres.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

The present invention provides methods and apparatus for accurately detecting, measuring, and removing rotational variability from a covered roll (sensing roll) used in nip presses. The invention compensates for this effect, allowing a more accurate display of the nip pressure profile to be calculated and displayed. The apparatus includes multiple sensors circumferentially spaced at various cross-directional positions along the sensing roll, which are used to measure pressure exerted on the web as it passes through the nip region. The pressure measurements are averaged to provide a more accurate nip pressure profile and rotational variability profile. The invention can be used to compensate for rotational variability in the sensing mechanism, allowing for more accurate nip pressure profile calculations and display.

<summary>Field of the Invention</summary>
The present invention relates to cellulosic fabric or textile materials, particularly to preparations for application onto a textile or fabric material, and textile articles comprising cellulosic fabric material applied with such preparations. The preparation comprises a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder and a binding agent, and the functional additive is carried by the wool particles. The preparation may include ultrafine wool powder, powdered bamboo fibre, or bamboo powder, and the functional additive may include anti-UV agents, such as zinc oxide or titanium dioxide, or other comparable agents. The preparation may also include ultrafine bamboo powder for improving moisture management properties. The preparation may be applied to a textile article, such as a t-shirt, and may be bonded to or deposited onto the textile material. The preparation may be provided with enhanced moisture management, wicking, and wrinkle recovery properties. The preparation may also enhance the anti-bacterial properties of the textile material. The summary concludes with the benefits of the present invention, including improved durability, moisture management, and anti-bacterial properties.

• The present invention provides an automatic quilting machine for sewing individual patterns into large fabrics such as bedspread or quilt, including a reprogrammable function integrated into the system, where the operator can independently program or reprogram the sewing machine functions and the frame table movements to make adjustments or changes in either the stitch or accessory functions such as trim, etc.

* The present invention is a method for manufacturing two-sided nonwoven fabrics with a three-dimensional image, enhancing the fiber distribution control layer, and improving the durability and aesthetic properties of the fabric.
* The method involves providing a fibrous matrix and a second matrix, forming precursor webs, and hydroentangling the precursor webs on a three-dimensional image transfer device.
* The precursor webs are imaged directly or subjected to further fiber, filament, support layers, or scrim layers before imaging.
* The use of a support layer or scrim benefits the fabric of the present invention, providing a median fiber distribution control layer and enhancing the overall performance of the two-sided fabric.
* The fluid-pervious support layer or scrim is selected from wovens, knits, open mesh scrims, and nonwoven fabrics, with a profile of 0.25 inch to 10 inches and a fiber denier of 1 to 22.
* The present invention is applicable to various end use products, including home cleaning, personal hygiene, medical, and other applications where a three-dimensional imaged nonwoven fabric can be employed.
* The material of the present invention can be utilized in the construction of disposable absorbent hygiene articles, medical gauze, protective wear, and apparel, providing improved resiliency, durability, and aesthetic properties.

<summary>Summary of the Connective Knitting Method for Tape-shaped Knit Fabric</summary>

* The invention involves a connective knitting method for two tape-shaped knit pieces, which can be used in a knitting procedure for a tape-shaped knit fabric.
* The method comprises knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces by a flat knitting machine with multiple needle beds, either front or rear, and overlaying symmetrical loops of the final course of both knit pieces across the boundary.
* The method uses a controlled computer to control the knitting process, allowing for repeated knitting of the end portions until the two pieces are connected.
* The method is applicable to various parts of the body, such as the collar of a sweater, neck rope portion of a tanktop, lower end portion of baseball stockings, and neck rope portion of an apron.
* The method reduces the appearance and comfort of the knit fabric by increasing the thickness of the end portions, which is undesirable in many cases.
* The method is manual and irregular, leading to lower productivity and increased manufacturing cost.
* The method uses a flat knitting machine with multiple needle beds, which is suitable for knitting tape-shaped knit pieces.
* The method can be applied to various materials, including tape-shaped knit fabrics, tape-shaped rope parts, and tape-shaped knit fabric knitted by a flat knitting machine.

• The invention provides a lockstitch sewing machine with a rotary hook arrangement that prevents bobbin housing rotation and reverses rotation, thereby minimizing thread movement impediments during looping.
• The rotary hook includes a bobbin housing with projections for holding a bobbin capsule, a spring-loaded holding finger, and a cutout for a thread passage gap.
• The spring-loaded holding finger is arranged on the bobbin housing and engages with a cam on the bobbin capsule, preventing bobbin housing rotation.
• The bobbin housing is supported in the hook body and rotates with the hook body, allowing thread passage through the gap.
• The capsule release device is driven by the bobbin housing rotation and provides a slight rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation.
• The bobbin housing is rotated counter to the direction of hook rotation, creating a narrow gap between the rear side face and the spring rod.
• The needle thread loop N is deflected around the shoulder 27, causing it to move unhindered through the gap 39 and through the capsule release device 50.
• The rotary hook has good sewing properties without the use of capsule release devices, with a low mass spring rod 37 bending back by the amount of thread thickness.

<summary>• The present invention provides a low-price, durable sewing machine detector that minimizes stress on optical fibers and reduces static noise due to vibration. • The detector includes a thin, compact detecting section with a thinner and more compact detecting section. • It minimizes curvature of optical fibers, reducing internal stress and improving efficiency. • The detector does not interfere with the operation of the control device and controller. • It provides accurate optical axes and a constant and stable operation. • It significantly reduces stress on optical fibers due to linear support. • It provides easy generation of accurate optical axes. • It includes an optical fiber power indicating cable for easy assembly and simplifies construction.</summary>

* The present invention provides a simplified process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness (degree of white).
* The process involves the completion of coagulation, treatment with water having a non alkaline pH, and drying, possibly finishing.
* The invention reduces the space take-up of spinning machines and speeds up the process.
* The process is carried out at a spinning speed not lower than 90 m/min.
* The water used should have a pH between 4.0 and 5.5 and free from cations.
* The water used should be weakly acid ion exchange resin.
* The water used should be weakly acid ion exchange resin with a pH of 4.6.
* The degree of white is measured by the Hunterlab apparatus and is improved through the use of weakly acid ion exchange resin with a pH of 4.6.

• The inventor developed a small deaeration tank with an inlet pipe, outlet, and tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe. The tank has an exterior diameter of 106.68 cm and a height of 211.46 cm. The inlet pipe has a center line between the upper surface of the slurry and the top edge of the tank, and the outlet has an outside diameter of 10.16 cm. The tank is closed and can be a pressure or vacuum tank. The outlet is located in the bottom plate of the tank, and the body of slurry is swirled by filtrate from washer 33. The height of slurry in the tank is controlled by the height sensor at the bottom of the tank. The tank has an emergency bypass line to allow for overflow.

* This invention improves upon the existing art by providing biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite structures with improved properties, including a very high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio. * The BTR composite is defined by a topology optimization process that maximizes the out-plane stiffness of a composite made of carbon fiber and epoxy matrix material. * The BTR concept is different from traditional fiber-reinforced laminate composites, where fibers are evenly distributed in the matrix material. * The BTR composite is designed to support static loads, dissipate vibration energy, and absorb impact energy. * The BTR composite is optimized using a function-oriented material design process, which considers functions such as out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.

• The invention provides a load-limiting device for braced frames that dissipates energy during a dynamic event.
• The load-limiting device may be placed in a braced frame structure that may have plastic deformation characteristics.
• The load-limiting device may be placed in a braced frame structure that may plastically deform during a dynamic event and may be positioned within a braced frame structure to dissipate energy when high lateral loads are placed on the braced frame structure.
• The load-limiting device may undergo plastic deformation when subjected to high lateral loads.
• The load-limiting device may be removed from the braced frame structure after a dynamic event.
• The load-limiting device may be easily removed from the structure if plastic deformation of the device is found.
• The load-limiting device may be easily removed from the structure of a building after a seismic event if plastic deformation of the device is detected.
• The load-limiting device may be configured with a variety of variations depending on the type of structure for which it is to be fitted.
• The load-limiting device may be interchangeable with new load-limiting devices.

• The present invention proposes a bedroom cabinet with a floor area equal to an area of a bed and a height such that a user can erect the upper half of their body on the bed.
• The bedroom cabinet has a vent on the panel which serves as a side wall surface, making the side wall portion likely to be decreased in strength and deteriorating the external appearance.
• The bedroom cabinet is composed of single layer panels and a vent is provided on the panel which serves as a side wall surface, reducing the external surfaces of the cabinet to be flat.
• The bedroom cabinet is of the dual construction comprising the outer casing and the inner casing, providing mechanical strength and a clearance between the outer casing and the inner casing.
• The bedroom cabinet has a clearance between the outer casing and the inner casing over the whole periphery, with spacer members interposed in the clearance to form a ventilation passage and sound-proofing effect.
• The bedroom cabinet is suitable for a flophouse facility with a number of individual rooms on the floor of an existing building, providing a flophouse facility with a limited floor area for rest and a dual construction with a lower outer casing and an upper outer casing.

* The invention is a pulsed power device and method for stimulating crude oil reservoirs using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods.
* The invention includes a multi-level discharge device that allows sequential firing of several sources in one well to extend the effective range of induced vibrations.
* The invention uses EM pulse sources that do not generate direct acoustic shock pulses, allowing for wider pulse durations and longer effective ranges.
* The invention includes directional energy cones for better targeting of specific reservoir scales.
* The invention uses hollow EH electrodes with a gas-injection device for improved electrode wear.
* The invention allows for directional control of the outgoing energy, enabling directed stimulation of hydrocarbon flow.
* The invention uses a flexible sleeve for isolation from fluids, maintaining acoustic coupling with the formation.
* The invention uses a multi-level tool for deployment in multiple wells to stimulate specific reservoirs.
* The invention uses EM pulse sources for better stimulation of hydrocarbons at grain and pore scales.
* The invention uses directional control of the outgoing energy to target specific reservoirs.

• The present disclosure describes a splice for a soil reinforcing element, including a first wave plate defining one or more first transverse protrusions configured to receive and seat a corresponding number of transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element, and a second wave plate defining one or more second transverse protrusions configured to receive and seat a corresponding number of transverse wires of a grid-strip. The splice may further include a first perforation defined in the first wave plate and a second perforation defined in the second wave plate, and a connective device extensible through the first perforation and the second perforation to couple the first wave plate to the second wave plate, wherein a portion of longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and a portion of longitudinal wires of the grid-strip are interposed between the first and second wave plates and are thereby prevented from removal. Additionally, the splice may provide a composite soil reinforcing element including a soil reinforcing element having a first plurality of transverse wires coupled to at least two longitudinal wires, the soil reinforcing element having a wall end and a reinforcing end, a grid-strip having a second plurality of transverse wires coupled to at least two longitudinal wires, the grid-strip having a splicing end, and a splice configured to couple the reinforcing end of the soil reinforcing element to the splicing end of the grid-strip. The splice may include a first wave plate defining one or more first transverse protrusions configured to receive and seat a corresponding number of the first plurality of transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element, and a second wave plate defining one or more second transverse protrusions configured to receive and seat a corresponding number of the second plurality of transverse wires of the grid-strip. The splice for the composite soil reinforcing element may further include a first perforation defined on the first wave plate and a second perforation defined on the second wave plate, and a first connective device extensible through the first perforation and the second perforation to couple the first wave plate to the second wave plate and clamp down on the at least two longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and the at least two longitudinal wires of the grid-strip.

* The present invention provides a novel design for a plow blade that offers a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, which can be produced with basic manufacturing processes, reducing the need for expensive wear items and complex manufacturing processes. * The plow blade in the present invention includes multiple component assemblies, allowing for easy reassembly and modification of the blade, making it adaptable in static plowing and vibratory plowing utilities.

* The present invention is a cavity wall construction technique that allows panels of greater than 2.4 meters in height and greater than 4 meters in width to be created without movement joints.
* The invention uses a proprietary plaster system with pre-papered hot-dipped galvanised zinc steel wire MCL® StuccoRite® Mesh Sheet and other reinforcement to achieve a nominal thickness of 21 mm with a standard sponge or plastic float finish.
* The plaster is applied in three coats: base coat, levelling coat, and top coat.
* The base coat encapsulates the pre-papered MCL® StuccoRite® Mesh Sheet reinforcement as well as additional reinforcement at corners and around joinery.
* The levelling and mesh coat contains further reinforcement in the form of fibreglass mesh (MCL® Fibreglass Mesh).
* The final skim coat is sponge or plastic float finish.
* The MCL® StuccoRite® Mesh Sheet is fabricated from copper bearing cold drawn hot dipped galvanised zinc vertical face wires and horizontal back wires, electrically welded at all points of intersection.
* The face and back wires are 1.5 mm diameter with openings not exceeding 51 mm.
* The reinforcement at all external corners is provided by MCL® uPVC Kwik corners being a 55 mm×55 mm angle with nosing and MCL®uPVC Kwik flanges, being 65 mm×15 mm angles with nosing, providing reinforcement at window and door openings.
* The MCL®Fibreglass Mesh is contained locally at certain openings in the base coat and continuously in the levelling and mesh coat.
* Movement is accommodated by providing physical breaks in the plaster.
* Joinery shall comply with E2/AS1 and be flashed with head and sill Z flashings as described in this Appraisal.
* To provide a moisture resistant surface, the completed plaster is sealed with the MCL® Water Repellent Plaster Sealer.

  * Wall wrap complying with Table 23 of E2/AS1.

- The present invention provides an enclosed floor track system for transporting wheeled trucks into and out of a fluid treatment chamber without contaminating the sanitary environment.
- The enclosed track system includes a wheel channel above the floor, with a cover plate overlying the channel to prevent showered brine from entering.
- The track system accommodates horizontally axled hand trucks with downwardly depending struts for improved mobility.
- The enclosed track system prevents brine solution from entering the track system and allows it to be recycled and reused.
- The track system segregates the hand truck wheel structure from the general environment within the fluid treatment chamber.
- The enclosed track system enhances recovery and reuse of the brine solution by separating the hand truck wheel structure from the general environment.
- The track system prevents corrosion of the hand truck wheel bearings and rubber wheels.
- The track system prevents brine solution from coming into contact with the hand truck wheels and becoming contaminated.
- The track system allows for efficient transportation of large quantities of meat products at a high rate of cooling.
- The track system maintains the sanitary condition of the chamber and recirculates the recovered brine solution.
- The track system is well adapted for use with wheeled hand trucks and can be pitched to drain liquid into a waste sewer.

* The tool has an outer body with a lower end and a central passage for a mandrel to pass through.

* The present invention provides an apparatus and method for constructing a retaining wall that allows for taller walls and shorter bases by pre-manufacturing parts of the wall to be transported to and assembled at the site.
* The retaining wall is made of precast concrete in two discrete, modular parts.
* Wall 10 comprises a precast concrete face panel 12 with an integral counterfort piece 14 and a precast base piece 16.
* The face panel 12 has a common height of twenty feet and can have a flat bottom, a triangular bottom, or a rectangular bottom.
* The counterfort 14 extends from the rear side of the panel 12 and has a flat bottom, a triangular bottom, or a rectangular bottom.
* The counterfort 14 can have an opening 20 for drainage near the bottom front corner.
* The face panel 12 may have more than one counterfort 14 providing support.
* The counterfort 14 can extend perpendicularly from the face panel 12 and have a base 16 extending rearward.
* The base 16 is generally a rectangular or trapezoidal platform with a base 30 extending vertically.
* The base 16 is precast concrete and does not require that it be cast in-situ at the construction site.
* The shear key 26 can be made between the face panel 12 or counterforts 14 and the base 16.
* The connection between the first module 11 and second module 15 is made by inserting an end of a piece of rebar into an opening in the other module and sealing with grout.
* The installer can place the second module 15 onto the first module 11 and lower the first module 11 onto the second module 15.
* The anchor 24 can be set into the opening 32 in the base 16 using a shear key or ship lap method.
* The installer can pump a high strength grout 34 into the opening 32 to fill the void and bond the two precast modular pieces 11, 15.
* The installer can backfill the area behind the retaining wall 10 with grout.
* The installer can create a cast-in-place impact barrier 44 on top of the wall 10 or behind the wall 10.

* The present invention addresses two primary shortcomings in conventional approaches to heating oil and paraffin downhole: (1) the heat is not properly focused where it needs to be; and (2) existing downhole heaters fail due to lack of design elements to protect electrical components from chemical or physical attack.
* The present invention provides an improved down hole heating system for oil and gas wells, focusing heat in the production zone to promote flow to the well bore.
* The system includes heat insulating packer, stainless steel tubing collar, and heating unit, designed to overcome the limitations of existing heaters and prevent damage or electrical shortages.
* The method for using the system includes heat treatment of oil or gas wells for improved well flow, using down hole heating unit with shielded electrical connections.
* The method can be used for treating iron sulfide occlusions in deep gas wells, improving oil or gas flow.
* The system is designed to focus heat in the production zone to promote flow to the well bore, preventing damage or electrical shortages caused by invasion by downhole fluids.
* The shielding of electrical connections between leads and rods is crucial for long-term operation of the system, ensuring reliable delivery of power to the heating unit.

• The invention is a simple and efficiently operable mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including objects that might be stuck or lost within a well bore.
• The mechanism includes an outer tubular body with an inner body structure that selectively moves into gripping relationship with an object to be removed from the well bore.
• The mechanism includes a collet structure with an internal cam surface that engages an object to be removed, and a spring element that maintains the collet structure in a locked or unlatched position.
• The mechanism includes a latching and unlatching mechanism that allows selective positioning of the collet structure relative to the object to be removed.
• The mechanism is designed to be used in various down hole service operations, including installation and removal of down hole tools and fishing operations for stuck or lost objects within the well bore.

• The example embodiment provides a method for manufacturing composed stave floors or engineering floors, including providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm. The base substrate and sight substrate are assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means. The multidirectional holding means consist of dendrites, adhesion, and horizontal reinforcement means, in the union plane; and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means, normal to the union plane. The example embodiment preserves the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate in composed stave floors or engineering floors. It provides a sight substrate for composite stave compounds or engineering floors without deforming, bonding both sheets without displacement or change of dimensions, and provides a major time of useful life and allows giving it corrective maintenance. The example embodiment eliminates the time and the inconveniences of the application of the glaze in a period of the installation. The example embodiment provides improved composed stave floors with applied glaze from the supplier, eliminating the time and the inconveniences of the application of the glaze in a period of the installation.

• The invention relates to ladders and specifically to ladder attachments for positioning the ladder away from the work surface, preventing the ladder from defacing the work surface, and preventing the ladder from slipping or sliding.
• The invention includes a brace for a ladder with first and second siderails connected by a rung. The brace includes an extension arm with a flange and an opening in the distal end. The flange has first and second openings. A U-bolt has legs inserted through the first and second openings of the flange. The legs have threaded ends and are spaced to receive the ladder rung therebetween. First and second nuts are threadably mateable with the legs of the U-bolt to secure the flange to the U-bolt.
• The invention also includes a resilient pad assembly pivotally connected to the extension arm. The pad assembly is pivotally connected to the arm to provide lateral stability and grip the work surface without damaging the work surface.
• The invention includes a clamp formed from an L-shaped piece of material. The arm has an opening aligned with an opening in the clamp. The clamp is positioned in abutting contact with the siderail and arm and secured with a bolt through the openings in the arm and clamp. The opening in the arm may be an elongated opening or slot so that the clamp can be moved or adjusted to accommodate different sizes of ladders.
• The invention includes a brace assembly with a resilient pad assembly and a clamp. The pad assembly pivots horizontally to contact opposite faces of a corner, allowing the ladder to straddle corners. The invention also includes a non-slip gripping portion for the ladder that effectively increases the contact area with the work surface without damaging the work surface.
• The invention includes a non-slip gripping portion for the ladder that effectively increases the contact area with the work surface without damaging the work surface.

• The present invention is a position sensor that generates an electrical signal proportional to the distance between a moving object and a fixed position.
• The sensor includes a waveform generator and an error correction generator for modifying the sensing signal by removing unneeded power and providing the signal to a remote monitor via two wires.
• The sensor monitors moving objects within specific limits or windows of timing to avoid unnecessary wires and reduce energy consumption.
• The sensor generates a relatively small reference signal that eliminates small values of drift in a negative going direction but not a significant amount of signal due to discrete calibration voltages.
• The sensor modulates a current across two wires to convert the sensor signal voltage into a sensor signal voltage.

<summary>**Flow Deflection Apparatus for High-temperature Turbines**</summary>

* The invention is a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures, specifically designed for rotor blades in gas turbines.
* The apparatus is characterized by a hollow casting form and separate inserts for cooling channels.
* The inserts are flat strips composed of a metallic or heat-resistant non-metallic material, facilitating easy adjustment and security.
* The apparatus is suitable for rotating guide apparatuses such as rotor blades, reducing the use of special internal cooling channels.
* The cooling system can be adjusted by changing the deflection radius of deflection devices or introducing connecting cross sections between cooling channels.
* The apparatus is particularly advantageous for gas turbines with complex geometries, simplifying assembly and attachment.
* The invention is characterized by a simple design and secure seating for the inserts, reducing centrifugal-force stresses.
* The apparatus is suitable for high-speed rotating blades, reducing the need for complex casting and simplifying blade design.

<summary>Summary of the Evaporative Cooler System</summary>
The evaporative cooler system operates more efficiently by a conjunction of features, including keeping the heat exchanger dry and wet sides separate, drawing working air from the load, and using a hybrid system with a minor portion of the useful air diverted to mix with the evaporator. The system achieves maximum cooling efficiency with sensible cooling, and can be used for specialized applications and high cooling rates.

• The present invention addresses the challenges of supporting and mitigating extreme loads on aircraft gas turbine engines and associated gearboxes.
• The mounting link between the engine and gearbox includes a male link and a female link, with the female link receiving the male link to dampen translation and form a radial interface.
• The link assembly can withstand extreme loads from blade-off events, hard landings, and other sudden shocks.
• The pin is selectively retained by the male link and female link to prevent detachment and maintain the linkage.
• The pin provides coulomb damping to absorb energy during translation, reducing the risk of pin shear.
• The pin can be replaced with an intact pin during maintenance following shock.
• The link assembly can be used to attach the engine to the gearbox, facilitating the transmission of torque and reducing the risk of damage.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>
The invention relates to archery equipment, particularly to a point cap system and balance pin system that can be adjusted in weight to provide perfect balance. The point cap system is made from hardened steel and is small and lightweight, reducing material and weight of arrow points and broadheads. The balance pin system is made from light material such as aluminum and is attached to the arrow shaft using an adhesive. The point cap and balance pin system work together to provide support and balance to the arrow shaft. The point cap and balance pin system also provides additional support to the end of the arrow shaft, reducing stress at the end of the shaft. The point cap and balance pin system can be used with graphite shafts, making it ideal for lightweight and balanced arrows.

• The Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for use with small arms training.
• It utilizes a low cost plastic expendable housing, metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system, and an expendable that can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech.
• The simulator produces sound and flash by the electrical ignition of pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion produced in a manner which utilizes the weapon's ejection port.
• It provides a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash.
• It is an inexpensive means to provide realistic training using an actual weapon.
• It provides a reliable, low maintenance, reusable small arms training device.
• It simulates the sound and flash of live rounds without modifying the weapon and without the use of mechanical actuation, other than in electrical switches.

• The present invention provides an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that enhances engine performance by maximizing the dynamic effect of the air flow, reducing noise from the intake, and operates at optimal volumetric efficiency.
• The device comprises a tank defining a volume, a first pipe defining a first passage interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage, and a second pipe defining a second passage interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage. The first and second passages are open to the intake passage at different locations with respect to each other, and the cross-sectional area of the second passage is smaller than that of the first passage.
• The valve is disposed in the first passage and is actuated by an actuator responsive to an engine operating condition.
• The cross-sectional area of the first passage is equal to or larger than that of the intake passage, and the cross-sectional area of the second passage is substantially equal to or smaller than about one-tenth that of the first passage.
• The second passage preferably opens to the air intake passage at a location nearer the air cleaner than the location where the first passage opens to the air intake passage.

* The rotary internal combustion engine has a water cooling system that functions to lower the temperature of metal areas exposed to high heat input and minimize temperature differences throughout the housing for preventing destruction.
* The most severe cooling problem resides in the area where combustion and expansion of the working gases take place, and the uneven heating can cause housing distortion which can prevent proper functioning of the gas and oil sealing elements.
* The time during which the combustion chamber is cooled by fresh inducted air is relatively short, allowing the wall temperature of the combustion chamber to be high and sensitive to changes in load.
* The maximum temperature of the combustion surface of the trochoid wall is much higher than that of the housing side walls, and local overheating can destroy the oil film on the trochoid surface.
* Sudden acceleration with a cold engine, especially in winter or when auto ignition occurs during high speed driving, exposes the rotor housing and associated trochoid wall to repeated sudden and very large thermal loads.
* The in-line arrangement of spark plugs creates a mechanism by which the flow of cooling fluid is disrupted, vapor films collect, and the flow is prevented from carrying away heat in a critical area.
* The in-line arrangement of spark plugs can lead to thermal distortion, which is highly dependent on the relationship between the cooling system, housing, and rotor seals.

• The present invention is a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.
• The method uses control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of a turbine control valve during testing.
• Total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet control valves is calculated as a function of control valve position (valve stem lift).
• The flow change due to closure of one of the N parallel flow paths during valve testing results in a change to the system that is controlling pressure from N valves to N-1 valves.
• The flow characteristic for each valve of the system with N valves, and for the system with N-1 valves, is determined during the turbine design process.
• The flow difference between the N and N-1 condition is known for any given valve not under test.
• The flow compensation function is used to minimize flow disturbance during valve testing.
• The flow compensation function is based on total flow demand and valve stem lift.
• The flow compensation function is applied to the total flow demand to each of the N-1 valves on the basis of the total N valve demand derived from the position of the valve under test.

<summary>• The invention provides a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus, including a valve body with a first inlet passage, a second inlet passage, an outlet passage, and a valve means for directing fluid from the first and second inlet passages toward the outlet passage. The valve means is adjustable to allow the mixture to range between 0% inlet A fluid, 100% inlet B fluid to 100% inlet A fluid, 0% inlet B fluid. The invention also includes a flow restricting device for reducing flow rate and a check ball valve for inhibiting backflow of water into the soap solution source. The valve system allows continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of soap solution and water emerging from outlet passage 38, with two mechanisms to maintain constant fluid pressures at inlet passages 28 and 32. The valve system also allows multiple users to operate from a common soap solution source and common water source without affecting fluid pressures.</summary>

The present invention proposes a method for compressing natural gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method includes compressing the gas at individual intervals to a higher pressure, cooling the compressed gas by heat exchange to a temperature above the exit temperature, and expanding the gas from the excess pressure to the desired exit pressure. The invention also provides an arrangement for carrying out the method. The method reduces the required investments and operation risk compared to conventional re-cooling technology. The invention is not limited by the described embodiments but can be modified within the scope of protection defined by the appended patent claims.

<summary>**Summary of the Invention****

* **Objectives**: The invention overcomes the disadvantages of previously known constructions, particularly in large size power transmission requirements, by providing an improved clutch unit with interleaved clutch plates and discs, capable of strong coupling forces and maintaining high control accuracy.

* **Features**:
  * **High Torque Control**: The clutch unit uses hydraulic fluid for retracting plate actuating means, reducing residual drag, and as a coolant for clutch discs.
  * **Improved Cooling**: Auxiliary fluid pressure control means urge clutch plates to retract from clutch discs, serving as a coolant.
  * **Reduced Disc Friction**: The arrangement minimizes residual drag, which is crucial for clutch units of the size and speed range of the applicant's invention.
  * **Minimized Residual Drag**: The clutch unit minimizes residual drag, which is essential for clutch units of the capacity, i.e., 85,000 h.p., of the applicant's invention.

* **Applications**: The invention is applicable to aircraft catapult systems, where it can be used in conjunction with large diameter clutch components.

• The invention involves a system for reducing exhaust emissions by utilizing multiple expansion cylinders and capturing the heat generated in the exhaust to power the crankshaft. • The system includes a water injection system that injects water into the exhaust gases to cool them and capture the heat. • The system also includes a water recovery system that recovers the water from the crankcase and uses it to power the expansion cylinders. • The invention aims to eliminate the need for a radiator and achieve steady-state thermal-to-mechanical efficiencies of 94-96%. • The system is designed to operate in cold environments and can be used in various types of internal combustion engines.

• The invention provides a plate consisting of a steel substrate and a precoat consisting of an intermetallic alloy in contact with the substrate, topped by a layer of metal alloy.
• The precoat is preferably an alloy of aluminum or based on aluminum.
• The thickness of the intermetallic alloy layer is preferably between 3 and 10 micrometers.
• The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed is preferably between 0.2 and 2.2 mm.
• The width of the area from which the metal alloy has been removed and which is not totally contiguous with the periphery of the plate is preferably between 0.4 and 30 mm.
• The width of the area from which the metal alloy has been removed must be adjusted to ensure welding with no introduction of any precoat into the molten area, sufficient corrosion resistance after subsequent alloying and austenizing heat treatment.
• The removal operation can be monitored by micrographic examination, and the removal operation can be stopped when there is a significant change in tone relative to the surface coating.
• The removal operation can be carried out at various stages of the production process, including after unwinding coils, before cutting to form a smaller format plate, or before welding the cut plate.
• The removal operation can be carried out by laser ablation, and the intensity or wavelength of the radiation emitted at the point of impact of the laser beam can be measured to stop the removal operation when the difference between the measured value and the reference value is above a critical value.

Field of the Invention The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from a sheet metal material and having an axial profiling formed by forming techniques and several rolling body guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction, the ring element being composed of at least two flat material ring segments which are joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction and are connected in a production step which precedes the formation of the axial profiling.
Background The object of the invention is to reduce the production costs associated with the manufacturing of rolling body guide cages by significantly reducing waste material during the manufacturing process.
Summary The invention provides a rolling body guide cage with a ring element produced from a sheet metal material and having an axial profiling formed by forming techniques and several rolling body guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction, the ring element being composed of at least two flat material ring segments which are joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction and are connected in a production step which precedes the formation of the axial profiling.
Method for Manufacturing a Rolling Body Guide Cage The method according to the invention involves forming a ring element from a sheet metal material and obtaining an axial profiling in the context of a forming step, wherein the rolling body guide cage forms several rolling body guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction and wherein, in the context of a method step which precedes the forming step, the ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments which are joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction.
Advantages of the Method The invention has been shown to be particularly advantageous in particular in the manufacture of rolling body guide cages with an internal diameter of more than 140 mm since the process costs associated with the formation of three weld joints are, at this diameter, already substantially below the material costs of the cutting waste which has hitherto arisen.
Advantages of the Rolling Body Guide Cage The rolling body guide cage according to the invention is suitable for the manufacture of radial bearing cages and axial bearing cages, in particular cages of groove and angular ball bearings. <summary>Summary of the Present Methods and Systems</summary>

The present methods and systems provide for obtaining, processing, and transmitting information related to providing customer service at a customer service location. They include using global satellite positioning to acquire latitude and longitude coordinates associated with the customer service location, updating databases with these coordinates, and generating directions for service technicians to travel between customer service locations. The systems also include a mapping system for routing travel from a first customer service location to a second customer service location, and a GPS system for obtaining and transmitting latitude and longitude coordinates of the input device. The systems also include a dispatch system for receiving, processing, and transmitting information related to actions to be performed at a customer service location, and a customer record system for storing customer related information. The systems also include a customer record system for storing customer related information, and a mapping system for routing travel from a first location to a second location where customer service is to be performed. The systems also include a GPS system for obtaining and transmitting latitude and longitude coordinates of the input device, and a dispatch system for receiving, processing, and transmitting information related to actions to be performed at a customer service location.

The invention provides a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, including two real triaxial magnetic field sensors and three pairs of compensation coils. The system includes a control unit with six inputs and six outputs for six virtual sensor signals and six control signals for six coils. The virtual sensor signals are calculated by averaging the real sensor signals, and the control signals are obtained by multiplying the virtual sensor signals by a 6×6 matrix. The feedback matrix C is determined experimentally by measuring the absorption of signals by the sensors of the second compensation system and calculating the corresponding feedback elements. The system can compensate for both homogeneous and inhomogeneous interference fields.

<summary>Method for Investigating Biological Samples Using CARS Microscopy</summary> * The invention provides a method for investigating biological samples using CARS microscopy, wherein a resonance signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering by excitation of at least one resonance site in the sample is sensed in image-producing fashion. The method comprises furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one further reaction partner.
